title: Getting Started With busccR
text: busccR available download via github.

title: Getting Started With busccR
text: Project tracking within package relies local access Statistical Consulting box folder. Box Drive must installed setup Baylor account provide access folder local file path. Installation instructions can found . using package, set_box_root() prompt user choose root folder statistical consulting center folder. prompt open file explorer user navigate “Statistical Consulting Center” select folder package find necessary folders.

title: Getting Started With busccR
text: status information consulting projects stored within folder called project_registry contains JSON file project information. Available functions within busccR update information include: - create_project() - update_project() - complete_project() build_registry() function compiles JSON files project_registry csv file called project_registry.csv contains information projects.

title: Getting Started With busccR
text: New templates included package provide consistency reporting. Currently one template reports one presentations. templates may addded later.

title: Getting Started With busccR
text: new report created create_report() function. function creates qmd file current directory containing project information (may eventually called inside create_project() function).

title: Getting Started With busccR
text: Presentations created create_presentation() function creates qmd file current directory using revealjs presentation.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Caleb Fox. Author, maintainer. Thomas Reinke. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Fox C, Reinke T (2026). busccR: Baylor University Statistical Consulting Center Project Management. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/cfox20/busccR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {busccR: Baylor University Statistical Consulting Center Project Management},   author = {Caleb Fox and Thomas Reinke},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/cfox20/busccR}, }

title: busccR
text: Welcome Baylor Statistical Science Consulting Center (BUSCC). BUSCC supports researchers, students, faculty across Baylor University providing high-quality statistical consulting, methodological guidance, data-driven collaboration. consultant, play essential role helping clients translate research questions rigorous, reproducible analyses. busccR package developed support consulting workflows within center providing tools, templates, tracking consulting projects.

title: busccR
text: goal busccR help BUSCC consultants: Maintain consistent consulting practices across projects Access reusable functions utilities analysis reporting Improve efficiency client-facing deliverables Improve project workflow track project status package intended internal use BUSCC consultants trainees.

title: busccR
text: new package, check reference website. best place begin Getting Started guide. Please read introductory article : Articles → Getting Started

what: Build a CSV registry of all consulting projects (base R only) — build_registry
title: Build a CSV registry of all consulting projects (base R only) — build_registry
text: Reads JSON project records project_registry folder Box root compiles single CSV file named project_registry.csv, stored Box root directory.

title: Build a CSV registry of all consulting projects (base R only) — build_registry
Build a CSV registry of all consulting projects (base R only) — build_registry
text: overwrite Logical; FALSE (default) project_registry.csv already exists, function stops. Set TRUE overwrite existing file.

title: Build a CSV registry of all consulting projects (base R only) — build_registry
text: Invisibly returns data.frame containing compiled registry.

title: Build a CSV registry of all consulting projects (base R only) — build_registry
text: implementation uses base R (package dependencies). Since base R provide full JSON parser, supports simple schema used package: top-level scalar fields arrays strings (keywords, methods, topics, consultants).

title: Build a CSV registry of all consulting projects (base R only) — build_registry

what: Complete a consulting project record — complete_project
title: Complete a consulting project record — complete_project
text: Marks project complete : setting end_date (defaults today), prompting user provide confirm methods, setting status "complete".

title: Complete a consulting project record — complete_project
code: complete_project(id = NULL, end_date = Sys.Date(), overwrite = FALSE)

title: Complete a consulting project record — complete_project
text: id Project identifier (JSON filename without extension). NULL, user prompted select project JSON file. end_date Project end date. Defaults Sys.Date(). May Date character string coercible Date. overwrite Logical; FALSE (default), performs optimistic concurrency check using file modification time. Set TRUE skip check.

title: Complete a consulting project record — complete_project
text: Invisibly returns named list containing: id registry_file end_date methods

title: Complete a consulting project record — complete_project
text: canonical JSON project record updated <Box Root>/project_registry/.

title: Complete a consulting project record — complete_project
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Complete with today's date complete_project(id = "2026sp_student_success_jdoe_example_edu")  # Complete with a specified date complete_project(   id = "2026sp_student_success_jdoe_example_edu",   end_date = "2026-02-15" ) } # }

title: Create a new presentation — create_presentation
text: function creates new .qmd file RevealJS presentation using Baylor Statistics Consulting Center theme.

title: Create a new presentation — create_presentation
Create a new presentation — create_presentation
text: file_name name file create (e.g., "presentation.qmd"). end .qmd, extension appended. title title presentation. authors character vector author names. subtitle subtitle presentation (optional).

title: Create a new presentation — create_presentation
text: name created file (invisibly).

what: Create a new consulting project — create_project
title: Create a new consulting project — create_project
text: Creates new consulting project : prompting user select project folder (relative SCC Box root), generating project ID form term_department_contact, writing canonical JSON project record project registry.

title: Create a new consulting project — create_project
code: create_project(   project_name,   term = NULL,   start_date = NULL,   category = NA,   contact,   department,   organization = NA,   status = "intake",   consultants = Sys.info()[["user"]],   notes = NA )

title: Create a new consulting project — create_project
text: project_name Project name (title). term Academic term label (e.g., "2026SP"). NULL, term inferred system date. start_date Optional project start date. Defaults Sys.Date(). category Optional category label (e.g., "Education"). contact Primary contact name email. Used form project ID. department Department name. Used form project ID. organization Optional organization name. status Initial project status. Defaults "intake". consultants Character vector consultant names. Defaults current system user. notes String additional notes project.

title: Create a new consulting project — create_project
text: Invisibly returns named list containing: project_id project_path (relative Box root) registry_file (full path JSON file)

title: Create a new consulting project — create_project
text: project registry stored <Box Root>/project_registry/, one JSON file per project named <project_id>.json.

title: Create a new consulting project — create_project
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ create_project(   project_name = "Student retention analysis",   consultants = c("Jane Doe", "A. Smith"),   category = "Education",   department = "Student Success",   contact = "jdoe@example.edu",   organization = "Example University" ) } # }

title: Create a new report — create_report
text: function creates new .qmd file standardized YAML header Baylor Statistics Consulting Center projects.

title: Create a new report — create_report
code: create_report(   file_name,   title,   client,   authors,   email = "rodney_strudivant@baylor.edu",   phone = "(254) 710-1663",   keywords = NULL )

title: Create a new report — create_report
text: file_name name file create (e.g., "analysis.qmd"). end .qmd, extension appended. title title project. client name client. authors character vector author names. email email address contact info (default: "rodney_strudivant@baylor.edu"). phone phone number contact info (default: "(254) 710-1663"). keywords Optional keywords include report.

title: Create a new report — create_report
text: name created file (invisibly).

title: Create a new report — create_report
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ create_report("project_analysis", "New Project", "Dr. Client", c("Student A", "Student B")) } # }

what: Get the configured Box root folder — get_box_root
title: Get the configured Box root folder — get_box_root
text: Retrieves stored path Statistical Consulting Center Box folder.

title: Get the configured Box root folder — get_box_root
Get the configured Box root folder — get_box_root
text: error_if_missing Logical. TRUE (default), function throws error (prompts interactive sessions) path set. FALSE, returns NULL. allow_interactive Logical. TRUE (default), function prompt user set Box root missing session interactive. Set FALSE force error tests scripts.

title: Get the configured Box root folder — get_box_root
text: character string containing normalized path, NULL.

what: Set the Box root folder for the Statistical Consulting Center — set_box_root
title: Set the Box root folder for the Statistical Consulting Center — set_box_root
text: Configure local path Statistical Consulting Center Box folder. path stored user-specific configuration file.

title: Set the Box root folder for the Statistical Consulting Center — set_box_root
Set the Box root folder for the Statistical Consulting Center — set_box_root
text: path Optional. character string specifying path Box root. NULL (default), directory selection dialog opened.

title: Set the Box root folder for the Statistical Consulting Center — set_box_root
text: Invisibly returns normalized path selected Box root directory.

title: Set the Box root folder for the Statistical Consulting Center — set_box_root
text: macOS, Box Drive path typically: /Users/$USER/Library/CloudStorage/Box-Box

what: Update an existing consulting project record — update_project
title: Update an existing consulting project record — update_project
text: Updates fields existing JSON project record stored project registry. Commonly updated fields include status, keywords, methods, abstract, project file path.

title: Update an existing consulting project record — update_project
code: update_project(   id = NULL,   status = NULL,   keywords = NULL,   methods = NULL,   abstract = NULL,   project_path = NULL,   append = FALSE,   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Update an existing consulting project record — update_project
text: id Project identifier (JSON filename without extension). NULL, user prompted select project JSON file. status Optional new status. NULL, status unchanged. keywords Optional character vector keywords. methods Optional character vector methods. abstract Optional new abstract. project_path Optional. Use "choose" select new project folder via file system. NULL, project path unchanged. append Logical; TRUE, keywords methods appended (deduplicated). Defaults FALSE. overwrite Logical; skip concurrency check TRUE.

title: Update an existing consulting project record — update_project
text: Invisibly returns list id, registry_file, updated_fields.
